title: Two Rivers Time Trial Training Series
Slobberknocker Epic
description: The 2015 edition of the Lake Sylvia Slobberknocker will return to its roots and start/finish at Camp Ouachita on the shore of Lake Sylvia. This event is going to be the final fundraiser for the Laura Wooldridge Memorial Fund and all proceeds will go directly to the project. We will offer two great routes with individual and 3 person team divisions. This will be a “Gutcheck” for bragging rights and will feature free post-ride food and beverage for all participants and volunteers. More details concerning routes and registration coming soon so check back and feel free to post to the Facebook event page any time.
course: Rolling Forrest service roads through the beautiful Ouachita National Forrest just West of Little Rock.
registration: On-line Registration at USACycling.org and on-site from 7:30-8:45.
directions: Camp Ouachita is located at 618 HWY 324 S. Perryville Arkansas, 72126.  From Perryville, travel south on HWY 9/10 for 7 miles and turn Right on HWY 324. Continue for 5 miles to Camp Ouachita on the right.  From Little Rock, take HWY 10 West for approximately 30 miles and turn Left on HWY 324.  Continue for 5 miles to Camp Ouachita on the right.

title: Rock City Races
description: A weekend full of exciting Criterium racing in two historic downtown Little Rock neighborhoods!
course:
Saturday is a technical crit in the heart of the revitalized 3rd and rock area in downtown Little Rock. Race starts on E. Capitol ave and there is a slight grade coming up the back side of the course.

Sunday has slightly more elevation gain and also proves to be a technical but fast course. In the heart of the historic SOMA district, the course is very spectator friendly with plenty of entertainment options for spectators.
registration: Early registration is on USAcycling.org and is $35.00 per race with through 10pm on 4-28. after that the price per race will be 40.00 online through midnight 4-30 or on site.
directions:
Saturday- Take the 9th st/ 6th St. Exit, go West on E 6th st. Turn right onto Ferry St., turn left on E 5th Street.

Sunday- From I-630 take the main St. Exit. Go South on Main Street.

title: Mountain View Epic
description: 68 or 100 mile mountain bike race through the Ozarks. You'll see fantastic views and lung-busting fireroad climbs.
course: This race is approximately 50% road/fireroad and 50% singletrack.
directions: We are starting at the Stone County Courthouse in Mountain View, Arkansas.

title: 2015 Ronde van Burns
description: Central Arkansas Velo (CARVE) is proud to present the 13th annual running of this central Arkansas summer tradition. This is a spectator friendly event and newcomers to racing are strongly encouraged to attend.
course: Course is a flat, Closed, 0.8 mile course with 6 turns located in the Burns Park Soccer Complex, North Little Rock Arkansas.
registration: Racers can Register online at usacycling.org up to 10:00pm CST the night before the race. On site registration will begin at 4:30 pm and the price is 10.00 for each race. Non-licensed riders must purchase a $15.00 one day USAC licence. USA Cycling release form required, riders under 18 years of age require the signature of parent or guardian.
notes:
Daily Payout- Top three finishers in the "A" & "B" races only. Daily payouts are 1st-$50, 2nd-$30, 3rd-$20. Cash and merchandise Primes will be announced and presented for each event. 

Series payout-Points will be awarded for the top ten finishers in each of the following groups: Cat 4 & 5, Masters 50+ and cat 1,2,3,4 as follows: 1st-25, 2nd-18, 3rd-15, 4th-12, 5th-10, 6th-8, 7th-6, 8th-4, 9th-2, 10th-1.
Payouts will be awarded based on the total points scored for each group as follows: 1st-$50, 2nd-$40, 3rd-$30, 4th-$25, 5th-$20

*Promoter reserves the right to adjust payouts if minimum rider requirements are not met.
directions: From I-40, take the Burns Park exit (#150) and go south, following the signs for the golf course. Do NOT go right on on Arlene Laman Drive. Rather continue through the golf course and go right at the stop sign onto "Tournament Drive". Continue straight on Tournament drive approximately 1 mile until you see barriers for the race. Go Right into the parking lot for soccer field #9 for parking and registration.

title: Battle for Townsend Ridge
notes: Arrive a minimum of 1 hours prior to race start time.
directions: HWY 12 to Piney Road to Townsend Ridge Trail Head

title: True Grit Ride 100
description: A fun ride to benefit the Community Services Clearinghouse. Saturday includes a road ride from 10 to 100 miles with plenty of well-supplied rest stops and a barbecue at the finish. Sunday is a Mountain Bike Ride.
course: Courses vary depending on length, but begin and end at Ben Geren Park on Highway 59, Zero Street.
directions: Ben Geren Park is on Hwy 59 due south of the airport.

title: Riverside at Iron Mountain
description: As part of the Arkansas Mountain Bike Championship Series, Riverside Classic is a cross-country race at one of Arkansas' premiere venues.
course:
9.5 mile loop for CAT 1,2 & 3  / 7 Mile Loop for Jr's 12 and under
Riverside Classic MT Bike Race Course is a single track loop.  Number of laps are based on Race category.

Well marked course.  Some sections are tight and twisty, others are big chain ring.

title: Cane Creek Timberland
description: This is the third Annual Cane Creek Timberland Bike Race. The race course is eight miles of fast-moving trails that run through the first hills of the Gulf Coastal Plain. The park features over 18 miles of trails with 52 bridges that are open to both riders and hikers after the conclusion of the race and throughout the year. Contact the park for more information about the race and registration details.
course: The course is a base of 8 miles long. CAT 3 racers will complete 1 lap, CAT 2 racers will complete 2 laps, and CAT 1 racers will complete all 3 laps.
notes: The race is held annually on the second Saturday in May. Registration begins as early as 7 a.m. and ends at 8:30 a.m.
directions: From Little Rock take I-530 South towards Pine Bluff. Take the Star City exit and drive to Highway 114. Make a left on Highway 114 and continue until it intersects with Highway 425 (the only redlight in Star City). Make a right and continue on 425 South in the left hand lane. Once you pass Southside Baptist Church look to make a left on Highway 293. Once you make this left continue on 293 for approximately 5 miles and the park will be on the left. Proceed to Pavilion 2 for registration purposes.

title: Arkansas State Time Trial Championship
course:
Course Description: The course will follow US Hwy 70 east to the junction of Hwy 70 and AR Hwy 31. As soon as
the road Y's, turn at the orange marker and return to the start line for a total of 40 kilometers. The course is out and
back and pancake at. Riders will start at 30 second intervals. Junior Events will be 20 kilometers. All Senior and
Master events will be 40 kilometers. The rst rider will start at 7:00am. You should plan to be at Galloway by 6:00am to
start warming up.
registration: Pre-Registration only. NO ON SITE REGISTRATION. Please register online at www.usacycling.org
notes:
* Merckx Division: One day license eligible
This division is limited to stock bicycles only. No
aerodynamic additions, aero wheels, bars or
helmets may be used. Pay out for these open
divisions is as follows:
- 1st Place - $75.00 (additional prize possible)
- 2nd Place - $50.00
- 3rd Place - $25.00
directions:
Directions: To get to Gallowa y, take I-40 east from Little Rock to Exit 161. Look for the Galloway Truck Stop on the
southwest side of the Interstate 40/Hwy 391 intersection. Proceed south on Hwy. 391 to Hwy. 70. The starting line will
be near the intersection of Hw y. 391 and Hwy. 70.

Eureka Springs Fat Tire Trail Tour
Arkansas State Road Race p/b Healthsouth
Hell on the border Arkansas State Criterium Championships

notes: this is a tough one day ride to determine if 5 people can work together to stay together over the entire course, just for the glory!
